output.conclusion: This course provides an advanced understanding of transportation engineering principles and practices, equipping students with the knowledge and skills to address complex transportation challenges.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Transportation Engineering! This course delves into the complexities of modern transportation systems, focusing on advanced concepts and practical applications for experienced engineers and researchers.

chapters.description: Explore advanced traffic flow models, including higher-order models and their applications in simulating complex traffic phenomena.
Apply queueing theory to analyze and optimize transportation systems, focusing on advanced queueing models and their limitations.
Delve into microscopic traffic simulation, covering car-following models, lane-changing models, and calibration techniques.
Examine advanced characterization techniques for pavement materials, including dynamic modulus testing and fatigue analysis.
Apply mechanistic-empirical pavement design methods, focusing on the AASHTOWare Pavement ME Design software.
Explore optimization techniques for pavement management systems, including life-cycle cost analysis and network-level planning.
Learn about activity-based modeling for transportation planning, covering model development, calibration, and validation.
Explore advanced travel demand forecasting techniques, including microsimulation and agent-based modeling.
Apply cost-benefit analysis to evaluate transportation projects, considering social, environmental, and economic impacts.
Examine connected vehicle technology and its applications in improving safety, mobility, and efficiency.
Explore autonomous vehicle technology, including sensing, perception, and control algorithms, as well as policy implications.
Apply life cycle assessment to evaluate the environmental impacts of transportation systems and promote sustainable practices.
